I suggest some ways to keep the pressure on world leaders to take action are:

1. contact your elected representatives: you can write, email or call your elected representatives, or attend town hall meetings, to let them know that you care about the issue of the syrian conflict and want them to prioritize it on their agenda.

2. join advocacy groups: you can join advocacy groups that work to raise awareness of the situation in syria and put pressure on world leaders to take action. some examples of such groups are avaaz, amnesty international, and human rights watch.

3. participate in protests or demonstrations: protests and demonstrations can be an effective way to draw attention to the issue and show solidarity with those affected by the conflict.

4. use social media: social media can be a powerful tool for raising awareness and amplifying the voices of those affected by the conflict. you can share news articles, photos and videos that highlight the issue and provide updates on the situation.

5. support charities: you can also support charities that provide humanitarian assistance to those affected by the conflict. donating money, clothing or other goods, or volunteering your time to charities such as the international rescue committee, unicef, and save the children can be an effective way to help those affected by the conflict.

these are just a few examples of ways you can help keep the pressure on world leaders to take action on the issue of the syrian conflict. the key is to stay informed and engaged and to use your voice and resources to support efforts to address the situation in a positive and constructive manner.
